author: Stevegiovanazzi
post_text: August 22, 2016 at 8:02 AM#1hi everyone,i'm in the world of granMA2, i start to create macro but i have a problem.. i can't find the list of all command.For exemple i know how make a macro for incremen the value of the dimmer, but i can do the same for color or RGB, or GOBO.I find some macro already maked with attribute but was all make for old version (2.5.7.XX).So there is some one that know where i can find this information?

posts.author: Stevegiovanazzi
posts.post_text: August 22, 2016 at 8:02 AM#1hi everyone,i'm in the world of granMA2, i start to create macro but i have a problem.. i can't find the list of all command.For exemple i know how make a macro for incremen the value of the dimmer, but i can do the same for color or RGB, or GOBO.I find some macro already maked with attribute but was all make for old version (2.5.7.XX).So there is some one that know where i can find this information?

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: August 22, 2016 at 2:21 PM#2[color=#66FF00]CmdHelp[/color] (or [Help][Help][Please]) will show you a list of keywords. Then [color=#66FF00]Help <keyword>[/color] will open the help manual to the article about that keyword.

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: August 22, 2016 at 9:33 PM#3[color=#99FF33]list attribute[/color] in the command line will display all attributes

posts.author: Stevegiovanazzi
posts.post_text: August 23, 2016 at 11:23 AM#4thanks so much bentoyligh... i was looking at this list. now i can make the my right macro.

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: August 23, 2016 at 2:06 PM#5list exec, list attribute, list effect etc.... when you're looking for something, always try list

title: list of command for attribute CMD
